data.title: Welcome, Intel Connected Care ACN Members
data.meta_description: People are asking for a better healthcare system. This means access to great doctors who deliver high quality care, better coordination among providers, and a way to manage the rising cost of care. Together with Intel, Arizona Care Network is creating A Better State of Care. Arizona Care Network (ACN) is a group of doctors and other healthcare providers who‚Ä¶
data.text:
July is #SarcomaAwarenessMonth. Sarcoma is a rare and challenging cancer that may not show symptoms in the early stages. Learn more about symptoms and treatment options for sarcoma in the link below from our partners at St. Joseph's Hospital and Medical Center and talk to your doctor if you have any questions or concerns about your risk level.This month we are raising awareness about a rare and challenging type of cancer. July is Sarcoma Awareness Month. Sarcoma patients may not show symptoms in the early stages, resulting in large tumors before symptoms are noticeable.

Learn more about symptoms and treatment options for sarcoma with the help of Dignity Health Cancer Institute. Visit: dignityhealth.org/arizona/services/cancer-care/cancer-types/sarcoma ... See MoreSee Less

Depression affects 16.1 million U.S. adults and anxiety affects 40 million adults every year. Almost 50 percent of people diagnosed with depression are also diagnosed with an anxiety disorder.

Learn more about common symptoms of depression and anxiety in the article below. It's important to talk to your doctor if you are experiencing these symptoms. ... See MoreSee Less

Common Symptoms of Depression and Anxiety - AZ Care Network

azcarenetwork.org

It's normal to feel anxious or sad sometimes, but when you feel down for weeks, it might be time to seek help.

Are you getting the quality care you deserve? Healthcare providers across the Valley partner with Arizona Care Network (ACN) to improve population health, manage the rising cost of care, improve the patient experience and increase provider satisfaction.

Contact our concierge team to find out if our network of doctors and facilities are in-network with your current health insurance plan. Call 602.406.7226 or email members@azcarenetwork.org. ... See MoreSee Less

Is Your Doctor Providing the Quality Care You Need?

azcarenetwork.org

ACN is a network of independent healthcare providers working together to improve the experience and care of Arizona patients.

Calling all parents! This is a great reminder from Papago Buttes Pediatric Center PC. If your child has not seen their doctor in over a year, schedule their wellness visit today. These annual check ups help you maintain your child's health as they head into a new school year.üçé‚úèÔ∏è

Note: Papago Buttes Pediatric Center is in-network for members of ACN.Back to School means Back to the Doctor! ü©∫

Summertime is the ideal time to schedule an appointment for your child's annual physical because it's right before the next academic year. üåûüï∂Ô∏è Your child‚Äôs yearly exam ensures that he or she is up to date on vaccines to protect against serious diseases. Safeguarding your child's health as well as the health of classmates, friends and others in your community is a top priority for doctors and school administrators. Schedule an appointment today. #backtoschool #annualphysical ... See MoreSee Less

An important reminder from our partners at Abrazo Health as we make our way through the hottest month of summer. Heat illness progresses from mild to severe and can be dangerous or life-threatening. Know the signs of heat illness so you can protect yourself and your loved ones. Visit the link below for more infoüëáü•µ‚òÄÔ∏è ... See MoreSee Less

Learn More

Signs of Heat Illness

spr.ly

Heat illness progresses from mild to serious and can be dangerous, even life-threatening.

Congratulations to our partners at Phoenix Children's on this expansion to the Northwest Valley. It will be such a gift for families living in this area to have access to world-class pediatric care.

Interested in more details on the new facility? Stop by the Community Open House on Saturday, July 27, from 8 a.m. ‚Äì noon to take a tour, enjoy kid-friendly games and activities, and much more. Check out the post below for more details! üëáPhoenix Children‚Äôs Hospital ‚Äî Arrowhead Campus is scheduled to open in August! Families are invited to get a sneak peek of our newest hospital during our Community Open House on Saturday, July 27, from 8 a.m. ‚Äì noon MST. Tour the state-of-the-art hospital, enjoy kid-friendly games and activities, nosh on snacks and refreshments, and much more. We hope you'll join our celebration as we expand world-class pediatric care for families in the Northwest Valley.

For complete open house details, visit our event page: bit.ly/4ctxUpG ... See MoreSee Less

Skin cancer is the most common cancer in the U.S. In Arizona, we have easy access to UV rays with an average of 299 sunny days per year. For years, culture has defined tan skin as beautiful and this can make it appealing to get that "summer glow," but is tan skin actually healthy?

We spoke with Dr. Matthew Woods from Desert Sky Dermatology to get an expert's feedback and recommendations on sun safety as we get deeper into the summer months. Learn more in the article below! ‚òÄüëá ... See MoreSee Less

From an Expert: What You Should Know About Sun Safety - AZ Care Network

azcarenetwork.org

In Arizona we have easy access to UV rays with an average of 299 sunny days per year. We got a doctor's recommendation on sun safety.

The doctors and care facilities who are part of ACN are highly committed to improving health outcomes and enhancing the patient experience. You can use our Find a Provider tool to search our network of over 6,000 providers and locate a doctor near you. Convenient, high-quality care is just a few clicks away. Get started by clicking the link below.üëáüîç ... See MoreSee Less

Our partners at Dignity Health Medical Groups shared important information about the link between stroke and heart disease in the video below. üëá Check it out to learn about the risk factors for both so you can protect your overall health. ... See MoreSee Less

Looking for a yummy treat that will cool you down in this summer heat? Look no further than the recipe our partners at Abrazo Health shared in the post below. üëá Stay refreshed with this mixed berry popsicle recipe that is full of protein and antioxidants that will fuel your body.Beat the heat this summer with a delicious mixed berry popsicle recipe! This easy-to-make frozen treat is perfect for all ages. Click here (spr.ly/61835z5IZ) for the recipe and instructions. ... See MoreSee Less

When you engage in mentally stimulating activities and make other healthy lifestyle choices surrounding your diet, exercise regimen, and smoking/ drinking habits, you may reduce your risk of dementia by up to 60 percent (according to a study by American Academy of Neurology (AAN)).

Check out the top 5 brain games we recommend weaving into your weekly routine to stimulate your mind and keep your brain healthy for years to come. #BrainAwarenessMonth üß† ... See MoreSee Less

5 Popular Brain Games Could Reduce Your Dementia Risk - AZ Care Network

azcarenetwork.org

A study revealed a healthy lifestyle including mentally stimulating activities could lower dementia risk, even for genetically prone individuals.

Do you have a child who is struggling to get the recommended amount of sleep for their age each night? He or she may be suffering from a sleep disorder.

The Insomnia and Sleep Institute of Arizona compiled a list of common sleep disorders seen in children in their post below. If you're concerned about your child's sleep, we encourage you to talk to a doctor.

Note: The Insomnia and Sleep Institute of Arizona is an in-network provider for members of ACN. ... See MoreSee Less

Congratulations to our partners at Valleywise Health on their successful transition to the new, state-of-the-art medical center in Phoenix at 24th and Roosevelt streets. We are grateful for the exceptional care you provide for patients across the Valley and look forward to seeing how this facility allows you to better serve our community. ... See MoreSee Less

Drowning is the leading cause of death among children ages 1 to 4 years old in Arizona. In 2022, 30 children died from drowning in Arizona. Children under 5 years of age are at the greatest risk.

Check out the tips in the article below from Arizona Department of Health Services to keep your children safe around the water this summer.üëáüèä ... See MoreSee Less

AZDHS | Drowning Prevention

www.azdhs.gov
